Page 3 of 4 pages
ARTICLE V COMMITMENTS OF THE ORGANIZATION
The Regional Director of the Organization and his staff will provide such technical advice and guidance as may be useful to the project.
ARTICLE VI
COMMITMENTS OF UNICEF
UNICEF will provide for use within this project supplies and equipment up to the value of $15,000 for the production of triple vaccine (Diphtheria, Tetanus and Pertussis).
ARTICLE VIII COMMITMENTS OF THE GOVERNMENT
1. The Government will provide all personnel, materials, supplies and equipment necessary for the project except as provided in Article VI, including:
(a) Personnel at the Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory as needed for the production of adequate quantities of triple vaccine.
0021 (b) Doctors, nurses and other personnel in hospitals, health centers, health stations and schools as required for carrying out the mass immunization. campaign. 140.112.213.82
(c) Equipment and supplies such as syringes, needles, sterilizers, cotton, alcohol, etcetera, as required for the mass immunization campaign.
(d) A team of senior medical officers and senior public health nurses for constant supervision of the mass immunization campaign.
2. The Government will meet all internal costs of the project, including:
(a) Salaries and allowences of all personnel engaged on the production of triple vaccine and of all personnel engaged in the operation and admin- istration of the mass immunization campaign.
(b) The cost of receiving and installing UNICEF equipment.
(c) All costs at the Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory in connection with the production of triple vaccine.
(d) The cost of all equipment and supplies required for the successful carry- ing out of the mass immunization campaign.
(e) The cost of publicity in connection with the project.
-3. The Government will keep the Organization and UNICEF informed of the progress of the project. Such reports as are required will be prepared periodically and submitted to the Organization and UNICEF.
4. The Government will authorize the publication, both national and international, of the results of the project and of the experience derived therefrom.
5. The Government will continue the program within the scope of its available resources when assistance from the Organization and UNICEF is withdisam.
Academia Historica
23
